meanings.definition: To use capital letters in writing.
meanings.sent1: Please capitalize the first letter of each sentence.
meanings.sent2: Remember to capitalize proper nouns in your essay.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to capitalize the title of the story.
meanings.sent4: In the book, the author chose to capitalize the names of magical creatures.
meanings.sent5: To make your writing clear, always capitalize the beginning of a sentence.

meanings.definition: To take advantage of or make the most of something.
meanings.sent1: Let's capitalize on the sunny weather and have a picnic.
meanings.sent2: She knew how to capitalize on her strengths to succeed.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox decided to capitalize on the distracted hen.
meanings.sent4: He always finds a way to capitalize on any opportunity that comes his way.
meanings.sent5: To succeed in business, you must learn to capitalize on your competitors' weaknesses.

meanings.definition: To provide funding for a business or project.
meanings.sent1: The investors agreed to capitalize the new startup.
meanings.sent2: They decided to capitalize the expansion of their company.
meanings.sent3: The generous donation helped capitalize the charity's initiatives.
meanings.sent4: The government grant will capitalize the research project for the next year.
meanings.sent5: To grow the business, they needed to capitalize the marketing campaign.

meanings.definition: To convert an asset into capital.
meanings.sent1: The company plans to capitalize its real estate holdings.
meanings.sent2: They aim to capitalize their intellectual property for additional revenue.
meanings.sent3: The decision to capitalize the land proved to be profitable.
meanings.sent4: By selling the old equipment, they were able to capitalize their assets.
meanings.sent5: To expand, they need to capitalize their existing resources effectively.
